# Conductor Tracks and Planning Guide
The Conductor system manages multi-session work through "tracks". Each track represents a major objective broken down into a plan.
## 1. Directory Structure
```text .conductor/ ├── product.md # Product requirements and objectives ├── tech_stack.md # Technology choices and constraints └── tracks/ └── [track_id]/ ├── plan.md # Checklist of tasks for this track └── sessions/ # History of agent sessions for this track ```
## 2. Plan State Machine
The `plan.md` file uses a standard checklist format:
- `[ ]` **Unstarted**: Task has not been attempted. - `[/]` **In Progress**: An agent is currently working on this task. - `[x]` **Completed**: Task is finished and verified.
**AGENT RULE**: Never work on more than one `[/]` task at a time.
## 3. Session Lifecycle
1. **Pick a Task**: Find the first `[ ]` task in `plan.md`. 2. **Mark In Progress**: Change it to `[/]`. 3. **Execute**: Do the coding work. 4. **Verify**: Run tests to prove completion. 5. **Mark Done**: Change it to `[x]`.
## 4. Retiring Tracks
When all tasks in `plan.md` are marked `[x]`, the Conductor will automatically retire the track. If you find the plan is no longer valid, document the reason in a new session log and let the Conductor re-plan.
